message:
Merge pull request #10300 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-11-05 23:08 UTC

ai_summary.Messages:
{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [ { "sha": "28bbca42659713244d304ca13c00797dcd080c4e", "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/concept-universal-continuous-access-evaluation.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 1, "deletions": 1, "changes": 2, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/896075136eb33132522d58e17fadb94288b5d21e/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-universal-continuous-access-evaluation.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/896075136eb33132522d58e17fadb94288b5d21e/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-universal-continuous-access-evaluation.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-universal-continuous-access-evaluation.md?ref=896075136eb33132522d58e17fadb94288b5d21e", "patch": "@@ -9,7 +9,7 @@ author: idmdev\n manager: sineado\n ms.reviewer: dhruvinshah\n ---\n-# Universal Continuous Access Evaluation (Preview)\n+# Universal Continuous Access Evaluation\n \n Universal Continuous Access Evaluation (CAE) is a platform feature of Global Secure Access (GSA) that works together with Microsoft Entra ID to ensure that access to the GSA edge is validated every time a connection to a new application resource is established. Universal CAE protects the GSA access tokens from theft and replay. Universal CAE revokes and revalidates network access in near real-time whenever Entra ID detects changes to the identity. Traditional Entra ID CAE requires each workload to adopt special libraries and is limited to first-party applications only. Universal CAE extends benefits of CAE to any application accessed with Global Secure Access, without requiring the application to be CAE aware.\n " }, { "sha": "9948c903854ab230b9d62a439068ed6da06f7d3e", "filename": "docs/id-governance/microsoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md", "status": "modified", "additions": 40, "deletions": 7, "changes": 47, "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/896075136eb33132522d58e17fadb94288b5d21e/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmicrosoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md", "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/896075136eb33132522d58e17fadb94288b5d21e/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmicrosoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md", "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmicrosoft-entra-id-governance-licensing-for-guest-users.md?ref=896075136eb33132522d58e17fadb94288b5d21e", "patch": "@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@ manager: dougeby\n ms.service: entra-id-governance\n ms.subservice: entitlement-management\n ms.topic: reference\n-ms.date: 09/22/2025\n+ms.date: 11/03/2025\n ms.author: owinfrey\n ms.reviewer: jercon\n ---\n@@ -17,13 +17,13 @@ This article outlines the pricing structure for Microsoft Entra ID Governance fo\n \n ## Monthly active users (MAU) billing model\n \n-Microsoft Entra ID Governance utilizes Monthly Active User (MAU) licensing for guest users which is different than licensing for employees. See [Microsoft Entra ID Governance licensing fundamentals](/entra/id-governance/licensing-fundamentals) for complete details on licensing for employees.\n+Microsoft Entra ID Governance utilizes Monthly Active User (MAU) licensing for guest users that's different than licensing for employees. See [Microsoft Entra ID Governance licensing fundamentals](/entra/id-governance/licensing-fundamentals) for complete details on licensing for employees.\n \n Under the guest billing model, guests are identified by a userType of **Guest** regardless of where the user authenticates. A userType of **Guest** is the default userType for all B2B invitation methods and can also be set by an Identity administrator. The bill for each month includes a record for each guest user with one or more governance actions in that month. See the Azure pricing page for pricing details.\n \n ## Billable governance features\n \n-Guest users are only billed when they actively use features that are exclusive to Microsoft Entra ID Governance. Features included with Microsoft Entra P2 aren't billed. Additionally, if a guest doesn't take any active governance-related action during a month—such as in cases where access was auto-assigned in a prior month—they won't be billed for that month.\n+Guest users are only billed when they actively use features that are exclusive to Microsoft Entra ID Governance. Features included with Microsoft Entra P2 aren't billed. Additionally, if a guest doesn't take any active governance-related action during a month, such as in cases where access was auto-assigned in a prior month, they won't be billed for that month.\n \n You can identify actions that will be billed to the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for guests add-on by looking at your audit logs. Specifically, each billable action has these properties included:\n \n@@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ You can identify actions that will be billed to the Microsoft Entra ID Governanc\n \n - GovernanceLicenseFeatureUsed: True\n \n-The following table contains a list of currently billable actions for **guest users**. This list might change as additional features are added to Microsoft Entra ID Governance.\n+The following table contains a list of currently billable actions for **guest users**. This list might change as more features are added to Microsoft Entra ID Governance.\n \n \n | Service  | Action | Billable event & API | Audit Log Where TargetUserType is Guest and GovernanceLicenseFeatureUsed is True |\n@@ -48,13 +48,13 @@ The following table contains a list of currently billable actions for **guest us\n | Entitlement Management | [Directly assign any user](entitlement-management-access-package-assignments.md#directly-assign-any-user-preview) | Bill on successful request creation when using directly assigning an access package to a user not yet in the directory.

**API**
https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/identityGovernance/entitlementManagement/assignmentRequests when using requestType \"*AdminAdd*\" for a user who doesn’t exist in the directory. | Entitlement Management invites external user. |\n | Entitlement Management |[Mark guest as governed](entitlement-management-access-package-manage-lifecycle.md) | Bill on conversion to governed user.

**API**
https://graph.microsoft.com/beta/identityGovernance/entitlementManagement/subjects where *\"subjectLifecycle\"* is set to \"governed\". | Update access package user lifecycle. |\n | Lifecycle Workflows  | [Workflow is run for guest](what-are-lifecycle-workflows.md) | Bill on workflow execution.
**API**
https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/identityGovernance/lifecycleWorkflows/workflows/{workflowId}/activate | Workflow execution started for user. |\n-| Access Reviews  | [Access Review – machine learning assisted access reviews](review-recommendations-access-reviews.md#user-to-group-affiliation) | Bill when guest user is included in review.

**API**
https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/identityGovernance/accessReviews/definitions where recommendation settings is enabled in a group review. | Decision item summary. |\n+| Access Reviews  | [Access Review – machine learning assisted access reviews](review-recommendations-access-reviews.md#user-to-group-affiliation) | Bill when guest user is included in review.

**API**
https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/identityGovernance/accessReviews/definitions where recommendation settings are enabled in a group review. | Decision item summary. |\n | Access Reviews  | [Access Review – inactive users](review-recommendations-access-reviews.md#inactive-user-recommendations) | Bill when guest user is included in review.

**API**
https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/identityGovernance/accessReviews/definitions where inactive guest reviews are included in the policy for a group resource. | Decision item summary. |\n \n \n ## Guest billing in multitenant organizations\n \n-Governance guest billing only applies for users with a userType of **guest**, so if Microsoft Entra ID Governance licensed member users are brought into additional organization tenants with a userType of **member**, they won't accrue to the billing meter.\n+Governance guest billing only applies for users with a userType of **guest**, so if Microsoft Entra ID Governance licensed member users are brought into other organization tenants with a userType of **member**, they won't accrue to the billing meter.\n \n If these users are brought in with a userType of **guest** they accrue to the meter, however you can avoid being charged by setting up\n or joining a multitenant organization. If the guest user is from a participating organizational tenant, the guest won't accrue to the\n@@ -148,7 +148,40 @@ billed to the governance guest add-on. Only governance features that are exclusi\n \n **Does Governance guest billing apply to all guest users, including those within the first 50,000 Monthly Active Users (MAU)?**\n \n-Yes, there is no free tier for governance billing. Governance guest billing applies to all guest users, even those within the first 50,000 MAU.\n+Yes, there's no free tier for governance billing. Governance guest billing applies to all guest users, even those within the first 50,000 MAU.\n+\n+\n+## Guest Governance Features Unavailable Without the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Guests Add-on \n+\n+To use Microsoft Entra ID Governance features for guest users, your tenant must be linked to an Azure subscription with the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for guests add-on. If the guest billing meter isn't enabled, the following behavior applies:\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Connecting the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Guests Add-on will be enforced beginning in January 2026. This list might change as more features are added to Microsoft Entra ID Governance.\n+\n+### Access Reviews\n+\n+- You won't be able to create new access reviews scoped to guest users if any of the following features are selected: \n+ - Inactive user access review\n+- User-to-group affiliation recommendation helper\n+ - You won't be able to update existing reviews that add these features.\n+\n+### Entitlement Management\n+\n+- You won't be able to create policies with guests in scope (“*For all users in your directory including guests*” or “*For users not in your directory*”) and the Microsoft Entra ID Governance features listed in this documentation (For example, sponsor approvers, custom extensions, and Verified ID).\n+- You won't be able to create new auto-assignment policies where a configured rule includes `userType=Guest`\n+- You won't be able to update existing entitlement management policies that add these features.\n+- You won't be able to perform these operations: \n+ -\tMark guest as governed\n+ -\tDirectly assign any guest user \n+\n+\n+\n+### Lifecycle Workflows\n+\n+- You won't be able to create new workflows if the workflow scope includes guest users: \n+ - The configured rule includes `userType=Guest`\n+- You won't be able to update existing workflows where the execution conditions include a scope with `userType=Guest`.\n+\n \n \n ## Related content" } ]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
Here's a summary of the changes:

The documentation for Universal Continuous Access Evaluation has been updated to remove the "(Preview)" designation from its title. Additionally, the licensing guide for Microsoft Entra ID Governance guest users has been significantly expanded. This includes a more detailed explanation of the Monthly Active User (MAU) billing model, a comprehensive list of billable governance features for guests, and an introduction to the upcoming enforcement of the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Guests Add-on, outlining specific features that will require it.

message:

If the guest user is from a participating organizational tenant, the guest won't accrue to the\n@@ -148,7 +148,40 @@ billed to the governance guest add-on. Only governance features that are exclusi\n \n **Does Governance guest billing apply to all guest users, including those within the first 50,000 Monthly Active Users (MAU)?**\n \n-Yes, there is no free tier for governance billing. Governance guest billing applies to all guest users, even those within the first 50,000 MAU.\n+Yes, there's no free tier for governance billing. Governance guest billing applies to all guest users, even those within the first 50,000 MAU.\n+\n+\n+## Guest Governance Features Unavailable Without the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Guests Add-on \n+\n+To use Microsoft Entra ID Governance features for guest users, your tenant must be linked to an Azure subscription with the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for guests add-on. If the guest billing meter isn't enabled, the following behavior applies:\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> Connecting the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Guests Add-on will be enforced beginning in January 2026. This list might change as more features are added to Microsoft Entra ID Governance.\n+\n+### Access Reviews\n+\n+- You won't be able to create new access reviews scoped to guest users if any of the following features are selected: \n+ - Inactive user access review\n+- User-to-group affiliation recommendation helper\n+ - You won't be able to update existing reviews that add these features.\n+\n+### Entitlement Management\n+\n+- You won't be able to create policies with guests in scope (“*For all users in your directory including guests*” or “*For users not in your directory*”) and the Microsoft Entra ID Governance features listed in this documentation (For example, sponsor approvers, custom extensions, and Verified ID).\n+- You won't be able to create new auto-assignment policies where a configured rule includes `userType=Guest`\n+- You won't be able to update existing entitlement management policies that add these features.\n+- You won't be able to perform these operations: \n+ -\tMark guest as governed\n+ -\tDirectly assign any guest user \n+\n+\n+\n+### Lifecycle Workflows\n+\n+- You won't be able to create new workflows if the workflow scope includes guest users: \n+ - The configured rule includes `userType=Guest`\n+- You won't be able to update existing workflows where the execution conditions include a scope with `userType=Guest`.\n+\n \n \n ## Related content" }. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: The changes update the Microsoft Entra ID Governance licensing documentation for guest users. Key updates include a revised date, minor wording adjustments for clarity, and the addition of a new section detailing features unavailable without the Microsoft Entra ID Governance for Guests add-on, such as specific Access Reviews, Entitlement Management, and Lifecycle Workflows configurations for guests. These restrictions are expected to be enforced from January 2026.
